content: all repeat rounds 1-2 until reaching your original total stitch count of 56 64 72 stitches you will have 28 32 36 instep stitches and 28 32 36 sole stitches on your next round remove bor k 36 48 54 stitches place bor this should be in the middle of the sole stitches if mc was used for the heel turn to right side k 8 9 10 place marker for bor the bor will run along the bottom of the foot setup round k 8 9 10 then pick up and k 15 17 19 stitches along edge of heel flap k across instep pick up and k 15 17 19 stitches along other edge of heel flap k 8 9 10 you will have 28 32 36 instep stitches and 46 52 58 stitches for the heel and gusset round 1 k to 3 stitches before instep k2tog k1 k across instep k1 ssk k to end of round round 2 k to instep k across instep k to end of round repeat rounds 1-2 until reaching your original total stitch count of 56 64 72 stitches you will have 28 32 36 instep stitches and 28 32 36 sole stitches ©jenniferbeaulieu2024 patternforpersonaluseonly forquestions pleasecontactellyndriaknits@gmail com 6 foot continue knitting in stockinette stitch in the round until reaching a length approximately 0 75 2 5cm before the toe or about 2 75 before the desired foot length if your row gauge is different than mine measure the length of the colorwork band on the leg to know how much room to leave for the colorwork band on the foot for the mc+2ccs version use cc1 for the background and cc2 for the motif or keep them the same as the first band and use the cuff color for the toe for the mc+1cc version use mc for the background and cc for the motif knit the chart you picked a total of 7 8 9 times around the leg for a total of 56 64 72 stitches cut background color toe for the mc+2ccs version use cc2 for the toe for the mc+1cc version use cc for the toe setup k one round round 1 k to 3 stitches before instep k2tog k1 k1 ssk k to 3 stitches before end of instep k2tog k1 k1 ssk k to end of round round 2 k all repeat rounds 1-2 until there are 14 16 18 stitches on each needle for a total of 28 32 36 stitches repeat round 1 until there are 8 8 10 stitches on each needle for a total of 16 16 20 stitches remove marker and k 4 4 5 so that yarn is now at the side of the toe and ready for grafting cut yarn leaving a long tail 12 or 30cm will be more than enough and using a tapestry needle graft remaining stitches together using kitchener stitch finishing weave in ends and make a second sock enjoy your socks
